did.physdesc: This collection contains 4 volumes of town minute books.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Minute Books for the Town of New Market, VA, 1806-1887, Accession #11000, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These volumes were given to the Library by Mrs. A.L. Hildreth, Jr. of New Market, Virginia, through H.E. Comstock of Winchester, Virginia, on January 10, 1991.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form
altformavail.p: Also available on microfilm as Manuscripts Division Reel #2330.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Topics in the minute books include annual Trustee elections, real estate evaluations, taxes, fire safety regulations, street and turnpike maintenance, stray animals, water system, business licenses, sanitation, and town officers, including the Overseer of the Poor.
There are several references to slave passes, patrols, hirings, and occasional individual slaves by name.
Of interest are denials of charges that hickory clubs were carried at the polls on election day, November 1883, to intimidate voters and allegations that the Democrats incited an election eve riot.
The minute books contain many entries in the hands of the Henkel family members.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection consists of four bound holograph manuscripts, numbered I, II, III, & V. Volume IV is missing from this collection.
